items.description: Rivers Clyst and Culm and their tributaries
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
Following the rainfall throughout Tuesday, river levels are continuing to steadily rise on the Rivers Clyst and Culm. Flooding of low lying land and roads close to the river is possible this evening and overnight. No flooding to properties is currently forecast.  

Take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions.
We are constantly monitoring river levels and have staff in the area checking for and clearing blockages in this location. This message will be updated on Wednesday morning or earlier if the situation changes.

This Flood Alert has been removed. 

Further light showers are forecast this evening but river levels are not expected to reach the Flood Alert threshold.  We will continue to monitor the situation closely.  Our incident response staff are checking the condition of defences and clearing debris from weed screens.  Please see the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast.

items.description: Langford and Wendlebury Brooks from Stratton Audley down to near Merton

floodArea.riverOrSea: Audley Brook, Langford Brook, Pingle Stream, Bure, Wendlebury Brook

items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected.
River levels are forecast to rise on the Langford and Wendlebury Brooks as a result of heavy rainfall. Therefore, flooding of roads and farmland is possible early tomorrow morning 19/05/21, especially in the Langford Village area. 
Further rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours.
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are in the area clearing weed/trash screens. 
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. 
This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 19/05/21, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Ray and its tributaries from Shipton Lee to and including Islip

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Ray, Wootten Brook, Doddershall Brook, Tetchwick Brook, Lugershall Brook, Murswell Hill Brook, Cutters Brook, Piddington Brook, Blackthorn Brook, Panshill Brook, Studley Wood Brook, Beckley Brook, Oddington Brook, Gallos Brook, Chipping Farm Stream

items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected.
River levels have stabilised on the River Ray but further heavy rainfall is forecast overnight and levels may rise again in response. Therefore, flooding of roads and farmland remains possible from tomorrow (19/05/21), especially in the Islip area. 
The forecast this evening and overnight is for showers that may be heavy at times. 
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are in the area clearing weed/trash screens. 
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. 
This message will be updated tomorrow morning 19/05/21, or as the situation changes.

items.description: South East Somerset Rivers, Upper Reaches

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Yeo, River Cam, River Wriggle, Barwick Stream, West Coker Stream

items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed. 

Further light showers are forecast this evening but river levels are not expected to reach the Flood Alert threshold.  We will continue to monitor the situation closely.  Our incident response staff are checking the condition of defences and clearing debris from weed screens.  Please see the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast.

Property flooding is not currently expected.
River levels have risen on the River Wey as a result of  heavy rainfall over the last few days. Therefore, flooding of roads and farmland is possible, especially in the Godalming and Passfield Mill area. 
The forecast is for some heavy rain this morning, clearing into a mostly dry rest of the day.
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are in the area clearing weed/trash screens. 
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. 
This message will be updated this afternoon 19/05/2021, or as the situation changes.

Property flooding is not currently expected.
River levels have fallen on the River Cole and Dorcan Brook but further heavy rainfall is forecast overnight and levels may rise again in response. Therefore, flooding of roads and farmland is possible tomorrow morning 19/05/21. 
The forecast this evening and overnight is for showers that may be heavy at times. 
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are in the area clearing weed/trash screens. 
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. 
This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 19/05/21, or as the situation changes.

River levels have risen at the Stinsford river gauge as a result of recent heavy rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible over the next 24 hours.  
We expect flooding to affect tributaries between Dorchester and Wareham.
Further showery, at times heavy  rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours.  We expect river levels to remain highfor at least the next 24 hours.
We are closely monitoring the situation.   
Please plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers which may be flooded and refer to local authority website for local road closures.  
This message will be updated Wednesday, 18/5/21, or as the situation changes.

items.message: The risk of flooding has reduced and river levels falling.
